stories.text:
The Apple M1 Ultra Soc chip achieves 87% of the performance of the Intel 12900K and Nvidia RTX 3090 while only consuming 34% of the power. The entire M1 Ultra chip draws 225W at full load and 11w at idle. Forget the Nvidia card and the other PC components, the 12900K alone can draw 250W.

This is a seismic shift. Can Intel, AMD and Nvidia catch up to this peformace per watt that Apple has on their hands?
stories.title: Ask HN: Can competitors catch up to Apple Silicon?

stories.text:
I've been learning solidity and want to implement a function that gives a 10 percent interest on the users who deposit their tokens. But to calculate the interest, what balance do I consider? end of each day/hour?

Or something a live interest -> Balance is X and time stamp A. Calculate the interest till the balance changes

Thanks in advance
stories.title: What balance to consider while calculating interest payments
Explosion of life on Earth linked to heavy metal act at planet’s centre
